channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Garden Fire, 16th June
item.description:
Neighbour has been burning things in the garden for 3 days. Cant hang washing out, cant open windows during cooler hours. Constant smell well into the night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hayden Road, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned road sign, 15th June
item.description:
Road sign and barriers been in place several weeks but no sign of ongoing work. Looks to be forgotten. Causing a pinch point in the road. Due to the curve of the road I have witnessed several near misses where south bound traffic moves to the middle of the road to avoid the sign and comes to conflict with north bound traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles overhanging lane, 15th June
item.description:
Gravel walk is once again a hazard to pedestrians and motorists as brambles and nettles have been allowed to get out of hand once again. Residents at the lower end of the lane leading out onto Southam Lane have allowed their boundaries to become overgrown.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Southam, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning and fly tipping, 15th June
item.description:
Street need cleaning and there broken glass and fly tipping of fridge freezer and matel there too
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Avon Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Avon road, 15th June
item.description:
Fridge freezer dump and mantel dump too and glass on the paths and needs litter picking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Avon Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham

item.title: Churn avenue, 15th June
item.description:
It needs litter pick rubbish on the path
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14-17, Churn Avenue, Whaddon, Cheltenham

item.title: Cardboard recycling fire, 15th June
item.description:
Looks like a cardboard recycling bag and it’s contents have been stolen and set fire too outside the school and although no longer on fire it’s left a big mess on the footpath next to the school with lots of people having to walk round it, Needs cleaning up and tarmac checked for damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant pavement parking, 15th June
item.description:
There is constant pavement parking on this road (whitecross sq) by many drivers along with nuisance cones and bins being placed to prevent others parking on the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, White Cross Square, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road surface, 14th June
item.description:
Massive potholes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on Blind Corner - deeper than before, 14th June
item.description:
This has been reported before with no action. On this corner one has to be well over on to the left and onto the verge as well as using the field gate access as a passing place. Please can the pothole be filled and the gate access also filled with hardcore to make it easier for traffic using this busy road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole Alley - impossible to drive over without risking damage to vehicles, 14th June
item.description:
This section of road on the Aggs Hill / Cotswold way has gotten so bad that it is impossible to drive over without hitting significantly deep potholes. Vehicles should NOT have to zig zag on a piece of road but have to do so to avoid damage. Why can it not be repaired properly please!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many seriously large potholes, 13th June
item.description:
There are very many seriously deep and wide potholes along an extensive stretch this of road. In some places it is impossible to go around them, and to drive this road at more than 10-12 mph is likely to result in serious (and expensive) damage to the car's suspension and steering.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath Now Virtually Impassable, 13th June
item.description:
Reported several weeks ago, now you can barely get through. It’s not acceptable when you increase council tax. If it’s not sorted soon I will be asking for the counsellors details.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Willowherb Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light failure, 13th June
item.description:
2 sets of temporary traffic lights both failed. Long queues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 18 inch pothole, 13th June
item.description:
Deep wide pothole on maple drive near number 48

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Maple Drive, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes along bypass, 13th June
item.description:
Stretch of bypass running alongside ten pin bowling needs assessing the pot holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Redundant Road Work signs in Lacation NOW for 9 Months!, 13th June
item.description:
The lcation is the gate to a field located at the entrance to Cleeve Common Road. 2 Redundant Road work signs have NOW been there for at least 9 Months. Please can they be removed or this problem passe to the department responsible for action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep and sharp edge Potholes + edge of road washed out, 13th June
item.description:
The location is on a blind bend on the left hand side going up Aggs Hill. A pothole and with the recent rain the edge of the road has been washed out causing a deep gully which could cause problems if a vehicle went too far to the side of the road while passing. In the same general location there is another pothole which is causing vehicles coming down the hill to swerve to miss it. Please can these be repaired
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsoil subsidence under tarmac on Edge of Public Footpath / Road, 13th June
item.description:
The location is Ham Lane. A relatively small hole was discovered at the location and reported to Water / Sewage Company who advised it was a Highways issue and they may have reported it already. However, the hole has gotten larger and with the problem being on a main turning point in the lane as well as around a series of drain pipes - the heavy weight of vans turning could well cause collapse of the road into as hole. A rod was put in the hole and several feet disappeared with little feel of having reached a bottom. Please can this be repaired as soon as possible as the footpath and the road are well used.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tone bag of gravel dumped, 13th June
item.description:
I tried to reply to your email but it wouldn’t let me. Here is another dumped 1 ton of random gravel from Morgan Supplies. Like the other one reported by KFC on Bristol Road, Morgan Supplies are dumping these 1 ton bags around Gloucester to illegally advertise. They need to be removed. They are nothing to do with road works or improvements, they are just put there purely for advertisements
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
